metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5863 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
In an ioctl handler in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, FirefoxOS for MSM, or QRD Android, several sanity checks are missing which canlead to out-of-bounds accesses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-95-generic - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-lowlatency - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-95-generic - 3.13.0-95.142
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-lowlatency - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-95.142').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
